title: Covid-19
cleaned_text: WELLNESS SERVICES BUILDING I-134 ATTENTION Before you toss your expired Covid 19 at home Antigen Testing Kits, please follow this link to see if your Covid 19 Antigen Testing Kits expiration dates have been extended by the FDA: [https://www.fda.gov/medical-devices/coronavirus-covid-19-and-medical-devices/home-otc-covid-19-diagnostic-tests#list](https://www.fda.gov/medical-devices/coronavirus-covid-19-and-medical-devices/home-otc-covid-19-diagnostic-tests#list) Save time and money! Options for Covid-19 Testing: OPTION 1: 1. Pick Up Free At-Home Covid-19 Antigen Test Kits at the Health and Wellness Center Building I 134 Pick Up Hours: Tuesday and Thursday From 10 am to 1 pm If you are not available to pick up during these business hours, please email [cuyamaca.wellness@gcccd.edu](mailto:cuyamaca.wellness@gcccd.edu). A Registered Nurse will contact you for further instructions. OPTION 2: 2. No-Cost Covid-19 Testing is available at [San Diego County testing sites](https://www.sandiegocounty.gov/content/sdc/hhsa/programs/phs/community_epidemiology/dc/2019-nCoV/testing.html). COVID-19 TEST AND TREAT INFORMATION: Covid-19 Test and Treat at Family Health Centers of San Diego " [Covid-19 test and treat](https://www.fhcsd.org/covid-19-test-and-treat/)" involves testing using a rapid test and being able to receive treatment within minutes of a positive test at the same location. Covid-19 Test and Treat Other Locations Use the [Test to Treat locator](https://covid-19-test-to-treat-locator-dhhs.hub.arcgis.com/) to find participating sites. Students Here is Your Covid-19 Daily Checklist: [Cuyamaca College Student Daily Checklist](https://www.cuyamaca.edu/covid19/student-resources/student-checklist.php) Instructions for Reporting Covid-19 to Student Health Services If you test positive for COVID-19, exposed with someone who has COVID-19, have COVID-19 symptoms, or have concerns or questions please do the following: Email [cuyamaca.wellness@gcccd.edu](mailto:cuyamaca.wellness@gcccd.edu) Please include your First and Last Name Student ID Number Phone Number Brief Description of your Concern A Registered Nurse will be in contact with you. Covid-19 Vaccines [Stay Up to Date With Your Covid-19 Vaccines](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html) (CDC) Click [here](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) to obtain your Digital Covid-19 Vaccination Record (California Department of Public Health) [Overview of Covid-19 Vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/overview-COVID-19-vaccines.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fvaccines%2Fdifferent-vaccines%2FModerna.html) (CDC) Where to get a vaccine (San Diego County sites) [San Diego County COVID-19 Vaccination Sites & Appointment](https://www.sandiegocounty.gov/content/sdc/hhsa/programs/phs/community_epidemiology/dc/2019-nCoV/vaccines/COVID-19-VaxEvents.html) [Family Health Centers of San Diego](https://www.fhcsd.org/vaccination-sites/) Possible Side Effects and Helpful Tips (CDC): [https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/expect/after.html](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/expect/after.html) What To Do (Center for Disease Control and Prevention) [How to protect yourself and others](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/prevention.html) [Caring for Someone Sick at Home](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/care-for-someone.html) Other Helpful Resources [San Diego County Coronavirus Disease 2019](https://www.sandiegocounty.gov/content/sdc/hhsa/programs/phs/community_epidemiology/dc/2019-nCoV.html) Department Organization Disease 2019](https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019)
